Race.SpecificTitle: City of Kenner -- Prop. #1 - HRC Amendment - City Council
Race.SummaryText:
CITY OF KENNER PROPOSITIONS
PROPOSITION NO. 1

SUMMARY:  A CHARTER AMENDMENT TO DELETE SECTION 4.33 OF THE CITY OF KENNER HOME RULE CHARTER WHICH MANDATES RESIDENCY REQUIREMENTS FOR DEPARTMENT HEADS.
Shall the Kenner City Charter be amended as follows:?
Race.FullText:
ARTICLE IV. ADMINISTRATION
Residency
Section 4.33. (begin strikethrough) Except as provided by specific hiring ordinance, applicable state law, and this Charter, department heads or board members need not be residents of the City or the State at the time of their appointment, but within six (6) months of their appointment, they shall become residents of the City and State. (end strikethrough)

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Kenner -- Prop. #2 - HRC Amendment - City Council
Race.SummaryText:
CITY OF KENNER PROPOSITIONS
PROPOSITION NO. 2

SUMMARY:  A CHARTER AMENDMENT TO DELETE SECTION 4.16 OF THE KENNER HOME RULE CHARTER WHICH PROVIDES FOR A BOARD OF SEWERAGE COMMISSIONERS.
Shall the Kenner City Charter be amended as follows: ?
Race.FullText:
ARTICLE IV. ADMINISTRATION 
Sewerage Districts
Section 4.16.(begin strikethrough) The Mayor, with the approval of a majority of the authorized membership of the Council, shall appoint a Board of Sewerage Commissioners as authorized by Subpart B, Part 1, Chapter 9, of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes (R.S. 33:3912), none of which may be an elected official of the City. Said Commissioners shall serve without compensation, except for any compensation which they receive from any other appointed position of employment with the City. (end strikethrough)

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Kenner -- Prop. #3 - HRC Amendment - City Council
Race.SummaryText:
CITY OF KENNER PROPOSITIONS
PROPOSITION NO. 3

SUMMARY:  A CHARTER AMENDMENT TO PROVIDE FOR THE ACTING MAYOR ORDER OF SUCCESSION.
Shall the Kenner City Charter be amended as follows:?
Race.FullText:
ARTICLE III. THE MAYOR 
Acting Mayor
Section 3.07. In the absence of the Mayor, the Acting Mayor shall be vested with the same powers and shall have the same duties as the Mayor. While serving as Acting-Mayor, he shall not participate as an officer or member of the Council, and his only compensation shall be his regular compensation as councilman. In the event that the Mayor and Council President as Acting-Mayor should be concurrently absent, then the order of succession shall be: 1. The Council Vice President; 2. Thereafter the (begin strikethrough) Councilman at Large not serving as Council President (end strikethrough) Councilman with the most consecutive years of service as a Councilman, and, should there be a tie, that the tie would be decided by a vote of the Council.
